intro: Lepidagathis mitis var. latifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved lepidagathis, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes numerous species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its broad, ovate leaves and small, clustered white or pink flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
